name: Pandemonium John Browne Signature Overdrive & Boost
description: STANDARD VERSION STILL AVILABLE, LIMITED EDITION SOLD OUT PRODUCT PICTURES UPDATED WITH THE STANDARD MODEL! Pandemonium - A place of uproar and chaos, that's what it translates to and I guess you could say that about being near John Browne of Monuments whenever he picks the guitar up and starts shredding it. John reached out to me looking for a booster/overdrive to help him push his sound even further and Pandemonium is the result of this. As a former member and co-founder of the band Vildhjarta I'm pretty familiar with the metallic sound associated with progressive metal that artists in the genre are looking for and John is no exception. Basically you want to be able to boost your base signal as much as you can and keep it relatively low gain and that's where many people fails dialing to much gain in. The Pandemonium pedal is one step in the right direction for that matter, it would be a lie saying it's a "metal-in-one-box" pedal cause that's not what the sound of progressive metal really is. Although as a tool to help you get there as it has a potential of the massive boost of 30+db (Clarity knob), this makes crisp palm muted riffing an easy task. On top of that you have the Attack/Defense switch which let you choose between the two settings. Attack will give you a boost to the bottom-end, more gain at hand of the Chaos knob and a slight boost in the mids section. Defence setting will give you more of a straight up cleanboost without colouring your tone. Hue knob plays only with the highs and will at a 12 o'clock position be pretty much neutral and true to your basic tone, turn it up and you have a more cutting and open sound. The notable thing about this booster/overdrive is the fact it's using mosfets for clipping unlike pedals such as the Tubescreamer which uses silicon diodes for clipping. Silicon diodes will give you a more compressed and unnatural type of sound where mosfets will preserve your tone and sound more open and realistic. Stacked opamps is another feature, this means there is two opamps on top of each other which have been carefully picked and blended to give you extra crisp and punch. Another cool feature is that I have made a built in voltage doubler, what this means is that you plug a 9V DC in and bam, the pedal runs at 18V DC to allow for more headroom and clearness, plug 12V DC and you have 24V DC feeding it. I would not recommend going any further then plugging a 12V supply into it. See this as a pre-order and keep in mind to allow 4-6 weeks for delivery as each and every pedal is handcrafted. Features: · 100% Handcrafted and Handwired in Sweden · Custom Lasercut Plexiglass Top with purple LED (Limited Edition, only 21pcs will be made, John owns serial #1) · Ships with certificate signed by John Browne · True-Bypass Operation · Neutrik Jacks · Alpha Potentiometers · High Quality AWG22 Straded Wiring · Standard 2.1mm 9V DC plug (doubles to 18V thanks to built in voltage doubler) DEMO

name: THALL Parametric EQ / Midbooster Vildhjarta Signature
description: So the pedal you all been waiting for, the Vildhjarta signature! Parametric EQ and Midbooster in one box! Features a parametric EQ with three knobs for each band. Level, Frequency and Q for low, middle & high. Midboost section is to give that extra massive punch to your mids and to dial in that heavy chugga chugga. Features Level and Boost knobs. Final design is yet to be unveiled but it will of course feature thall! They will be avilable in different colour combinations as well. Releasedate: Fall 2013 Features: · True-Bypass · Neutrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG24 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option

name: Le Rat
description: First pedal that I put to "production", it's hard to say that it's production as they're all made by hand from scratch. This is my take on the classic Rat, it's actually a hybrid between the classic Rat by ProCo and the famous Landgraff MO'D with a few of my own personal mods and fixes, the result is a stunning distortion that goes from bluesy type sounds all the way up to in your face raw distortion. I've added a 3-way switch which let's you choose between "stock" silicon 1N4148 clipping, lift clipping diodes and yellow led's in the third position, this gives endless possibilities to your tone. Of course the famous LM308N chip is under the hood in this one, just like the original Rat/MO'D. The "Soothing" knob does exactly what it says really, gives you the choice of soothing out the amount of distortion or scoop it even further. There's also the "Level", "Filter" and "Noise" knobs of course. The pedal in the pictures are just for reference, you are free to choose any color on the enclosure that I have in stock, same goes for the knobs and color of the LED. If you want to have custom artwork you just choose that option from the dropdown menu and we sort it out. Give me ideas and i'll come up with something! Features: · True-Bypass · Neautrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG22 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option · Green Bright LED DEMO

name: Neon MP Deep Blue Delay
description: Yup, a clone of the famous and loved Mad Professor Deep Blue Delay. One-off splatter neon design with clear knobs. One of the best sounding delays out there. Demo below is not the same pedals but the exact same circuit. Features: · True-Bypass · Neautrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG22 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option · Green Bright LED DEMO

name: Teklanika Overdrive
description: Clone of the sought after Klon Centaur, sounds just like the original! Also includes the famous input buffer like the original and because of that it's actually and of the very few non true-bypass ones i've done. Plexi-top that glows in the dark when engaged. Features: · Neautrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG22 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option · Red Bright LED's

name: Boiling Pink
description: This is a clone of the famous Rockbox Boiling Point which is a TS at heart with some mods to it. Don't think it need any further presentation really. The original costs about 450 bucks. This is, just like the original swirl painted, the swirl may not be the best one i ever done but it's still cool looking. Features: · True-Bypass · Neautrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG22 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option · White Bright LED

name: SpiderPurr 4-Knob Keeley Compressor
description: Clone of Keeley 4-knob Compressor which is Keeleys take on the classic Ross Compressor. Features: · True-Bypass · Neutrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG24 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option · White LED

name: Spider Box
description: Modified clone of MXR Blue Box Octave down pedal. Modified in that way it has better volume control and a bit less noise then the original unit. Spider effect painted with a metallic blue as base. Blue LED to match the rest as well as those aluminium knobs. ONLY ONE AVILABLE, SHIPS IMMEDIATELY! Features: · True-Bypass · Neutrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG24 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option DEMO

name: Bloody Midboosting
description: A simple yet powerful midbooster to get that extra punch to your basic tone or solos! Volume and Boost knobs. Custom bloodstained design. ONLY ONE AVILABLE, SHIPS IMMEDIATELY! Features: · True-Bypass · Neautrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG24 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option

name: Tempest Treble Booster
description: Straight up clone of the famous Catalinbread Naga Viper treble booster, old design featuring old Reaper Pedals logo. It's a spare one that I finished after having it undone on my desk for a while. Brand new and unused! Featuring a plexitop that glows when engaged. ONLY ONE AVILABLE, SHIPS IMMEDIATELY! Features: · True-Bypass · Alpha Pots · AWG24 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option DEMO

name: Four Headed Delay
description: What is this really, i find it hard to explain... it's a delay but not your typical delay, it's a distortion/fuzz, it's a noisemonster. Think of it as a delay with a really really twisted edge, which can also do quite some regular distortion etc. But all in all it's a monsterous noisebox, I guess a demo would be appropriate... Will try to sort that out a.s.a.p! ONLY ONE AVILABLE, SHIPS IMMEDIATELY! Features: · True-Bypass · Neautrik Jacks & Alpha Pots · AWG24 Straded Wiring · 9V DC (Negative center) · No battery option DEMO

name: ToneOffender (TBA)
description:
My own take on the classic ToneBender Fuzz.
The original uses Germanium transistors as we all know, those germaniums tend to be dodgy if they run to hot and are therefore not really tour friendly.
I've come up with a version that is a Silicon based ToneBender that will run stable no matter what, but it uses rare and unusual Silicon transistors to get the same type of sound Germaniums would have delivered. I've also implented a Bias control to be able to have full control of the biasing and be able to create broken speaker sounds.
These will only be made in a limited run.

Releasedate: Fall 2013
